snippet: Over 400 million Chinese are unable to speak the national language, and large numbers speak it badly, state news media said Thursday as the government began another push for linguistic unity.
abstract: Chinese state news media report that more than 400 million Chinese are unable to speak Mandarin, national language, and large numbers speak it badly; government continues to push for linguistic unity.
lead_paragraph: Over 400 million Chinese are unable to speak the national language, and large numbers speak it badly, state news media said Thursday as the government began another push for linguistic unity.
